result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L. Hilt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment and/or schooling as medically able.  May not seek employment or be a volunteer where defendant will handle money, unless agent gives written agreement to do so.

Submit to DNA sample.  No contact with B.N. or Tower Technologies.  Must complete budget counseling.  Undergo any other counseling per agent.  Sign releases of medication and healthcare obligations.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L. Hilt

records.addlTxt: 09:02 AM Defendant Michelle L. Hilt by Zoom audio and video.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Zoom audio and video.  Michelle L. Hilt appeared by video means.  Agent Abney by Zoom audio and video.  DE did not seek counsel for today as she assumed that Mark Lawton would be here since the paperwork indicated it went to him also.  DE does not request a reset to seek counsel.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE wishes to proceed without an attorney today.  Court finds waiver to be freely, knowingly and voluntarily made and accepts the waiver for today.  State requests an extension of probation for 2 years.  DE indicates that she has been on social security but is trying to get employment.  DE indicates she did make a payment in February and March and has set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts for $75 a month.  Court extends probation for 2 years.
Probation review hearing on March 17, 2021 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michelle L. Hilt in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lawton received copy of PSI, no corrections.  Victim notification met.  Written and oral statement provided by victim.  State gives sentencing argument.  Attorney Lawton speaks up regarding sentencing argument of State.  State responds.  Court responds.  State continues with sentencing argument.  Attorney Lawton makes final statement.  Defendant makes final statement.  $158,295.58 noted.  Court withholds sentence.

Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Michelle L. Hilt in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Count 2 & 3 Dismissed/read in.  Parties requesting PSI.  State agrees to cap at PSI recommendation.  $158,295.58 agreed upon restitution.  Bond continues pending sentencing.  Defendant may argue hardship, payments an payment plan.  Attorney Lawton agrees.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders PSI and to be filed by April 25, 2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michelle L. Hilt in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lawton notes matter isn't resolved but ADA Ryan stated he would be filing an amended information.  Court states matter will remain on the JT calendar.  Bond continued.

Attorney David William Franker appeared by phone means for Defendant Michelle L. Hilt. Prosecuting Atty Dennis Ryan appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michelle L. Hilt not in court.  Atty. Franker did discuss w/defendant on withdrawal of counsel.  State has no objection to motion.  Court grants motion to withdraw counsel.  Remove from FPT and JT calendar.  Bond continues.

Defendant Michelle L. Hilt in court with attorney David William Franker.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 3.  Bond continues.
Defendant Michelle L. Hilt in court with attorney David William Franker.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.
